description: Photographs and maps reveal the intensity of Tuesday’s earthquake and the extent of the damage.
title: Buildings Across Mexico City That Toppled in the Earthquake
title_page: Buildings Across Mexico City That Toppled in the Earthquake - The New York Times
maintext:
A powerful earthquake, with a preliminary magnitude of 7.1, struck Mexico on Tuesday afternoon. It was centered southeast of Mexico City in the state of Puebla and caused heavy and prolonged shaking across central Mexico.

Though the epicenter was about 100 miles from Mexico City, structures swayed violently, facades crumbled and buildings collapsed.
